image.altText: A son and father stand next to each other and smile.

props.synopsis: As 94-year-old Australian war veteran Patrick Forbes prepares for his final Anzac Day march, he reflects back on his family's history of service which saw three members awarded the distinguished Military Cross.

title.children: Final Anzac Day march for veteran from three-time Military Cross family

image.altText: A man with a blonde beard wearing a blue stripy polo shirt and a baseball cap

props.synopsis: WARNING: This story contains details that readers may find distressing. The family of a baby who died 42 hours after being "violently shaken" by his father has been left with "silence, grief and an emptiness that will never fully go away", a court has heard.

title.children: Family tells court of ongoing pain over death of 'innocent, defenceless' baby

image.altText: A concept image of two workers in high-vis walking past a row of large batteries.

props.synopsis: A large battery project in South Australia sells for nearly $500 million as investment in renewable energy surges.

title.children: Millions invested in big batteries amid net zero transition

image.altText: A woman sitting down next to dogs.

props.synopsis: A group of Australian pet owners who say their dogs suffered adverse effects or died after receiving an osteoarthritis treatment are working to launch a class action, after a lawsuit was filed in the United States.

title.children: Pet owners consider class action over osteoarthritis drug

image.altText: A man with pointy hair and maroon t-shirt smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: A man accused of the shooting murder of South Australian police officer Jason Doig has been found mentally incompetent by the state's Supreme Court.

title.children: Man charged over SA police officer's death found mentally incompetent

image.altText: Asian Elephant

props.synopsis: Sydney's beloved Asian elephant pair is preparing for a new life with a herd on the plains of South Australia.

title.children: After a century in Sydney, Taronga Zoo says goodbye to its elephants

image.altText: Gloved hands holding COVID-19 vaccine, needle in glass container.

props.synopsis: Three local councils in South Australia have been passing motions questioning vaccines, but health experts say they are based on misinformation and heighten community risk.

title.children: Councils under fire for promoting vaccine scepticism

image.altText: The landscape of White Cliffs from the air

props.synopsis: Before the remote town of White Cliffs got state-funded transport to Broken Hill 300 kilometres away, some locals went long stretches without essential services and supplies.

title.children: Outback bus service 'essential' to far-flung opal mining town

image.altText: A woman wearing sunglasses running on the road

props.synopsis: A trip to the hospital and some badly mangled feet couldn't stop Amber Bryant as she ran from Adelaide to Broken Hill to raise funds and awareness for endometriosis.

title.children: Runner completes 500km in the dark for endometriosis awareness

image.altText: Aliir Aliir of Port Adelaide catches a ball during an AFL game.

props.synopsis: The Swans are trying to find out if the fan who through an object over the fence at Port Adelaide's Aliir Aliir during their AFL clash is a member.

title.children: AFL fan removed by police after throwing object at Aliir

image.altText: A man in a maroon collared shirt is pictured seating

props.synopsis: At this year’s federal election, the South Australian seat of Boothby is one of the state’s two marginal seats. As part of the ABC’s “Your Say” campaign, we spoke to residents in the electorate about their biggest concerns.

title.children: Boothby is a relatively wealthy electorate, but voters still worry about the cost of living

image.altText: A large black and white cruise ship with a tug on the water.

props.synopsis: A luxury cruise ship will stop in Wallaroo in 2027, carrying almost 500 passengers, renewing the town's hope of benefiting from the cruise industry.

title.children: Cruise ships to return to SA's Copper Coast after seven-year hiatus

image.altText: A man in religious garb sitting in front of a red curtain, looking on

props.synopsis: As he glided around St Peter's Square in his popemobile on Sunday, the fact he was 88 and had just spent several weeks in hospital somehow seemed a distant memory. Then everything changed.

title.children: Pope Francis's final hours: A simple dinner and a meeting with an adversary

image.altText: Pope waves from wheelchair in white with red cardinals behind him

props.synopsis: Pope Francis's passing reminds us yet again of the complete absence of women in the upper echelons of the church. This is despite the fact that he did more to elevate women than any other pope.

title.children: Women still locked out of church leadership, despite huge impact on their lives

image.altText: An older man wearing glasses with grey hair delivering a speech at a conference table, looking stern.

props.synopsis: The President of the Palestinian Authority in the West Bank has demanded the militant group free the remaining 59 Israeli hostages held in Gaza and hand over its weapons.

title.children: 'You sons of dogs': Palestinian leader blasts Hamas in hostage release demand

image.altText: Damen Changde tug

props.synopsis: A new fleet of tug boats ordered for the Australian Navy by the Defence Department were secretly built at a Chinese shipyard under a $28 million contract awarded last year to a Dutch company.

title.children: Australian Navy's newest boats made in China

image.altText: An image of sandstone buildings against a blue sky

props.synopsis: In New Zealand, there is now a conversation about an organisation called Atlas Network and whether or not it has influenced the right-bloc government's agenda.

title.children: Growing questions in NZ about an organisation called Atlas Network

image.altText: A segment of a chart showing the proportion of votes going to the ALP, the LNP and 'Other candidates' at the 2022 election.

props.synopsis: This triangle is going to help us explain how Australian politics has fundamentally changed over the past five decades.

title.children: This triangle helps explain a titanic shift in how Australia votes

image.altText: Pauline Hanson cocks her head to the side while looking down her nose between the shoulders of two men

props.synopsis: Two of Australia's most striking populist figures are again at odds; this time, over preference deals. Here's how it could influence the election.

title.children: Preference deals could change who wins in some seats

image.altText: Peter Dutton with his hand to his forehead.

props.synopsis: More than 3 million current and former university students promised 20 per cent reductions in their student debts under Labor would not get that saving under a Peter Dutton government, and electric vehicle subsidies will be scrapped under the party's proposal to cut "wasteful spending".

title.children: Dutton campaign backtracks on EV subsidy claim

image.altText: Modern Signaller

props.synopsis: They often shy away from the spotlight, but signallers play a crucial role in defending Australia. They'll be recognised for their service by leading Anzac Day marches across the nation.

title.children: The invisible soldiers keeping Australia safe for a century to be recognised

image.altText: police officers tape off a crime scene

props.synopsis: An elderly man is in hospital after being allegedly punched by a teenager outside a polling booth in Sydney's inner west.

title.children: Teen charged for allegedly punching elderly man at Sydney polling booth

image.altText: A storm cloud approaching land on an autumn afternoon

props.synopsis: From showers in the east to a chilly dawn service in the west, this is the Anzac Day weather forecast across Australia.

title.children: Parts of Australia's east set to be soaked this Anzac Day

image.altText: A male lion roaring and showing its sharp teeth.

props.synopsis: New research suggests a skeleton which belonged to a gladiator was mauled by a lion or another big cat during combat.

title.children: Bones suggest a lion gnawed on Roman gladiator's body while he died

image.altText: Stephen Bates in a cowboy hat.

props.synopsis: Who will finish first of the three candidates in the sunshine state's most anticipated three-cornered contest?

title.children: In Brisbane's three-way contest, who ends up on top?

image.altText: Six soldiers in camouflage holding guns stand in the back of a small car looking out

props.synopsis: The attack is the worst on civilians in the country since the 2008 Mumbai terror attack.

title.children: Massive manhunt underway for gunmen who killed 26 in Kashmir

image.altText: The Apple tech company logo of an apple is illuminated in white against a black background

props.synopsis: The two tech giants were fined by the European Union's watchdogs as they step up enforcement of digital competition rules.

title.children: Apple fined $890m and Meta $356m for breaching new EU laws

image.altText: People gather outdoors following an earthquake shock

props.synopsis: The earthquake has injured more than 150 people and is centred in the Sea of Marmara at a shallow depth of 10 kilometres.

title.children: Powerful 6.2 magnitude earthquake hits Istanbul with more than 150 injured

image.altText: Woman wearing high vis vest passes box of produce to woman wearing red puffer jacket over the counter

props.synopsis: Green waste bins are supposed to reduce the amount of organic matter going to landfill, and in Geelong, it's also feeding residents.

title.children: What happens to the waste in our green bins? In Geelong, it's feeding the community

image.altText: An older woman waits to cross a tree-lined street in a country town.

props.synopsis: London plane trees are a feature of many Australian towns and cities, but some say it's time they were removed amid mounting reports of infrastructure damage and pedestrian injuries.

title.children: Are these 'magnificent' street trees doing more harm than good?

image.altText: Two 18-year-old teenage men standing in court.

props.synopsis: The haul of Giant African harvester ants could have been worth more than $1 million, and has drawn attention to wildlife trafficking of smaller animals.

title.children: Two teens plead guilty to trafficking $1 million worth of giant ants in Kenya

image.altText: Online gambling generics man with phone

props.synopsis: The Coalition says if elected they will create a national database of domestic violence offenders and introduce other measures to tackle the abuse epidemic.

title.children: Coalition unveils $90m domestic violence strategy

image.altText: Elon Musk sits in the Oval Office wearing a red baseball cap that says: "Trump was right about everything"

props.synopsis: Tesla boss Elon Musk will cut back on his commitment to the Trump administration's DOGE and recommit to the carmaker, in a move cheered by investors after what analysts have called a "disaster" result.

title.children: Tesla investors cheer 'beginning of the end' of Musk’s White House stint

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds up a Medicare card as he speaks animatedly.

props.synopsis: Time and time again, the Coalition has been forced to deny claims about plans to privatise Australia's healthcare system.

title.children: PM has been brandishing a Medicare card and Dutton is reaping what he sowed
